body_html: It looks like the issue here is how torch.frac and torch.floor deal with negatives - torch.floor seems to "round down" and truncates a negative value to the next smallest negative number (i.e. -3.2 becomes -4), while torch.frac seems to truncate -3.2 to -3 explaining why the output of torch.frac(torch.Tensor([-3.2])) is -0.2.
body_text: It looks like the issue here is how torch.frac and torch.floor deal with negatives - torch.floor seems to "round down" and truncates a negative value to the next smallest negative number (i.e. -3.2 becomes -4), while torch.frac seems to truncate -3.2 to -3 explaining why the output of torch.frac(torch.Tensor([-3.2])) is -0.2.
body: It looks like the issue here is how `torch.frac` and `torch.floor` deal with negatives - `torch.floor` seems to "round down" and truncates a negative value to the next smallest negative number (i.e. `-3.2 becomes -4`), while `torch.frac` seems to truncate `-3.2 to -3` explaining why the output of `torch.frac(torch.Tensor([-3.2]))` is `-0.2`.
